page.title: 09The Tractor and Bailer
page.content: The tractor is the work horse of the farm. It is used for pulling attachments such as the plough. Tractors work like cars but they have far more power and can pull as much as a lorry and some say they can do the work of four horses. Tractors vary greatly in price, ranging from about Â£4,000 to over Â£30,000. Another important piece of machinery on an arable farm is the bailer. It is used to collect the straw and to compress it into large bundles. Some produce rectangular bundles and cost between Â£4,000 and Â£5,000, and others produce round bundles and cost between Â£7,000 and Â£9,000.
